news_header: Nordnet has temporarily shut down its online services due to reports of users accessing others' accounts, with no evidence of a cyber attack.
news_original_title: Nordnetin Suvi Tuppurainen: Asiakkailta alkoi tulla raportteja pääsystä muiden tileihin – Nordnet sulki palvelunsa
news_text: Nordnet, an online bank and stock broker, has closed its services as a precaution after reports from users in Nordic countries about unauthorized access to accounts. Country Director Suvi Tupurainen stated that there is currently no indication of a hacker or cyber attack. The bank requires a predetermined counter-account in another bank to prevent unauthorized withdrawals. While transactions and orders were still possible, the exact status of operations was unclear. Following the announcement, Nordnet's share price fell by 5% on the Stockholm Stock Exchange, marking its largest decline in two weeks. The services are expected to be restored as soon as possible.
